subject: Programming
title: How Images Are Stored
description: A quick, practical guide to How Images Are Stored.

hook.text: Zoom into any photo far enough and you'll see tiny colored squares â€” pixels.

buildup.text: Each pixel stores three numbers: red, green, and blue values from 0 to 255.

discovery.text: A 12-megapixel photo has 12 million pixels, each with three color values. That's 36 million numbers.

twist.text: Your eyes blend these tiny squares into smooth images. The illusion works because pixels are small.

climax.text: Every photo, video frame, and icon is just a grid of numbers your screen lights up.

punchline.text: Pictures are grids of numbers in disguise.

quiz.question: What three color values does each pixel store?
